main event: An observer in Des Moines, Iowa reported seeing a bright light moving northward on 7 April 1949.
interesting points: The observer described the light as brighter than day and resembling a sun spot., The object was seen from an upstairs bedroom where the observer had to kneel to view it., The object was reported to be twice the size of a full moon, with colors of reddish, yellow, and purple., The observer noted that he had seen three saucers previously and didn't consider this incident similar., Neighborhood witnesses noted the observer's eccentric behavior and reputation for making unusual claims.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: An older retired man, described as odd and eccentric by neighbors.
